summary: The Making Agricultural Products Locally Essential (MAPLE) Act is a bipartisan bill that proposes expanding the Seniors Farmers' Market Nutrition Program. It seeks to amend the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 to add maple syrup to the list of eligible foods that seniors can purchase using program benefits. This change aims to provide seniors with more locally sourced food options while simultaneously supporting maple syrup producers. The bill was introduced in the U.S. House of Representatives and has been referred to the Committee on Agriculture.
